layerspy package

layerspy

Submodules

layerspy.layers module

Module providing base functions

class layerspy.layers.Layer(zone_data)

Bases: object

A class for storing layer data

copy()

Method to return a copy of a layer

Returns:

Layer: A copy of self

get_layer_subset_from_function(fun)

Method to create a layer object from a selection function.

Args:
fun (func): A function to select zones with

certain properties

Returns:

Layer: defined by new similarities defined by your function

get_sum_of_property(prop)

Method to ge the sum of a specific property in all zones

get_zone_data()

Method for retrieving the zone data of a given layer

Returns:

dict: of zone data

make_mixed_layer(weight_dictionary, mix_label)

Method to mix a layer based on a given weight dictionary

Args:

weight_dictionary (dict): A dictionary of weights

Returns:

Layer: A single zone layer containing the mixture

make_weight_dict(prop=None)

Method to make a weight dictionary for weighted averages

Args:

prop (str): A string of a property to define the weights of each zone

Returns:

dict: of the weight to be assigned to each zone in a layer. Defaults to equal weights.

merge_layers(layer)

Method to merge a layer into self

Args:

Layer (Layer): A layer to merge with self

Returns:

On successful return ‘self’ will contain zone data from layer

remove_zones_from_layer(zone_keys)

Method to remove zone data by keys from a layer

Args:

zone_keys (list) A list of keys to remove from zone data

Returns:

On successful return any zones with the unwanted keys will be removed.

Raises:

ValueError: If any of the keys in zone_keys does not exist in the layer

update_layer(zone_data)

Method to add zone data to an existing layer.

Args:

zone_data (dict) A dictionary of zone data

Returns: On successful return the additional zone data will

be added to the layer

layerspy.layers.add_dicts(dict1, dict2)

Method used to average layers

layerspy.layers.create_empty_dict_structure(dictionary)

Method used to average layers

layerspy.layers.mult_dict_vals(dictionary, multiplier)
Method to multiply dictionary values to be used in the __mul__

operator for layers

Args:

dictionary (dict): dictionary to be scaled

multiplier (float): Scalar to multiply the dictionary by

Returns:

On successful return the dictonary will be scaled by multiplier

layerspy.layers.sum_dicts(dicts)

Method used to average layers
